author: r-darwish
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement
When setting Powershell as the default user shell in a unix system using `chsh` it is not allowed to pass any arguments to the shell. Thus, a Unix user which wants Powershell to be its default shell cannot avoid the logo.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Perhaps we could have an environment variable that determines whether the logo is displayed?

comments.author: r-darwish
comments.body: I think that environment variables will cause some chicken and the egg problem. Usually, users define environment variables in files such as `~/.profile` which are eventually read by the user shell. There are other ways such as `~/.pam_environment` or `~/.config/environment.d/*.conf` when using systemd, but I don't know if there's a way to do that in macOS.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We could add an option in powershell.config.json file (and GPO).

comments.author: rashil2000
comments.body: Any updates on this issue? I feel this is much needed.

title: Ability to disable the startup logo without specifying arguments
